subject: Re: Testing inner classes with junitx
msgSnippet: ... (Maybe this mail will appear twice: couldn t see my first post). Casting to your private Type is not the way to do: Object p = invoke(d, mostFlexible ,
messageBody:
--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, Leila <leilakal@y...> wrote:
>
> I have no idea where to start. Since the following
> code would not compile:
> Pair p = (Pair) invoke(d, "mostFlexible", new Object[]
> { mcss });
> Pair (the inner class) is not recognized in junitx
> test.
>

(Maybe this mail will appear twice: couldn't see my first post).

Casting to your private Type is not the way to do:

Object p = invoke(d, "mostFlexible", new Object[] { mcss });

Than invoke any method on it:

Object result = invoke(p, "myMethodName", NOARGS);

or get a field:

Object field = get(p, "myFieldName");

Regards,

Jean-Hugues de Raigniac
